TopicTitle: Are there any planets that are tidally locked to the sun?

Articles.Content:
This is a fairly straightforward question. I would like to know if there is anywhere that I can count on having solar power all the time.

Edited November 2, 2013 by Kenken244

I'm afraid not. Several moons are tidally locked to their planets, but nothing is locked to the sun. Even the polar regions are not a safe bet for round-the-clock exposure, as they have hills and valleys that can cut you off.
Moho WAS tidally locked to Kerbol (the sun), but now it's not.
